data.name: Composed Integers Having Prime Factors Only Once
data.description: The integers 6, 15 and 970 have a common property. In their prime factorization, the prime factors occur only once. In effect: ``` Number Prime Factorization 6 2, 3 15 3, 5 970 2, 5, 97 ``` Nevertheless, the following numbers do not follow the presented property: ``` Number Prime Factorization 25 5, 5 50 2, 5, 5 169 13, 13 ``` We are interested in collecting the positive integers that have prime factors with one occurrence. Expressing the previous condition using formulas it would be: For that purpose we need to make the function ```onceoccurr_primefac()``` (Javascript: ```onceoccurrPrimefac()```, that receives an argument, ```nMax < 20000```, as an upper limit (excluded from the result). Our function will output a list of one element dictionaries as follows (values as example purpose only): ``` python [{"amount numbers": 317}, {"total Sum": 343544}, {"odd": 149}, {"even":168}] ``` Let's see some examples: ``` python onceoccurr_primefac(100) == [{'amount numbers': 35}, {'total Sum': 1906}, {'odd': 16}, {'even': 19}] /// the found numbers with this property are : 6, 10, 14, 15, 21, 22, 26, 30, 33, 34, 35, 38, 39, 42, 46, 51, 55, 57, 58, 62, 65, 66, 69, 70, 74, 77, 78, 82, 85, 86, 87, 91, 93, 94 and 95 (35 numbers) total Sum = 6 + 10 + 14 + 15 + 21 + 22 + 26 + 30 + 33 + 34 + 35 + 38 + 39 + 42 + 46 + 51 + 55 + 57 + 58 + 62 + 65 + 66 + 69 + 70 + 74 + 77 + 78 + 82 + 85 + 86 + 87 + 91 + 93 + 94 + 95 = 1906 odd = 15, 21, 33, 35, 39, 51, 55, 57, 65, 69, 77, 85, 87, 91, 93 and 95 (16 numbers) (We don't accept 1 as it can't be prime factorized - it has only one factor, itself. even = 6, 10, 14, 22, 26, 30, 34, 38, 42, 46, 58, 62, 66, 70, 74, 78, 82, 86 and 94 (19 numbers) /// onceoccurr_primefac(150) == [{'amount numbers': 56}, {'total Sum': 4532}, {'odd': 26}, {'even': 30}] ``` Prime numbers should be discarded for obvious reasons and it's advisable to have a fast way to do it to have faster code. Enjoy it!!
